summary: Lily of the valley is a beautiful woodland flower with white, bell-shaped blooms that smell sweet. It grows in Asia, Europe, and North America. Despite its beauty, it's very poisonous if eaten. It has many names, like May bells and Our Lady's tears. In France, it's called muguet, and its scent is used in perfumes. In old England, it was known as glovewort, good for soothing sore hands.
title: Lily of the valley
